website_summaries.verdict: With impressive features other back scratchers don't have, it's like two tools in one.
pros: Dual-sided head with moderate and aggressive scratching spikes
Sturdy, retractable handle reaches up to 26 inches, which is several inches longer than other models
cons: Users with sensitive skin may find the aggressive side too sharp
The head occasionally flips from side to side when in use

customer_reviews.title: specifically a cancer that makes you itch like poison ivy is boiling beneath the skin
customer_reviews.text: So I have cancer, specifically a cancer that makes you itch like poison ivy is boiling beneath the skin. I thought the spikes on this might be too rough but I was willing to give it a try, but it is perfect. This product really does work awesome and doesn't cut me like my own nails. It is nice to have two sides, I mostly use the shorter spikes but the longer spikes are great as well. It is smaller than I though, but so far that has been great because I took it on travel with me. When you pull it out all the way it is strong. Really like this product and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: After months (years?) of witnessing my wife angle for the right spot to scratch on her back I came across the Cactus Scratcher. I think it was her most prized Christmas gift! The Cactus Scratcher does the trick with two different scratching sides and the telescoping handle. It was the perfect gift and the perfect design for her.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two, Both Broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. The first broke after about three weeks. The second one only lasted about a week. They both broke at the end of the second telescoping section from the head. It looks like there is a pin there that falls out. This is a nice-looking and useful product while it lasts. It's too bad they can't put a little more effort into the reliability. I'm not returning it since it would cost as much in shipping as the scratcher is worth. I gave this company two chances but now I'll look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3... all 3 broken in 2 days!
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY low quality which I was not expecting for the price. I bought 3 of them and they all broke within 2 days. It was the same issue with all 3. When I pulled to expand the metal rod it came apart and does not reconnect. $40 down the drain. You’re better off picking one up from the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: JAX

customer_reviews.title: Better luck with a fork.
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly made. It broke within months of purchase. The telescoping connectors become loose and then just pull out . Not worth it. Just buy a cheap wooden one.
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: Good, yet small
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is probably ‘my bad’ as they say... It is way smaller than I expected. I didn’t read dimensions, so that’s my fault. I saw the pics in the description and thought the blue cactus part was going to be about the size of a hair brush. It’s the size of a baby hair brush (see picture) 😂 That being said, it’s of good quality and works as expected. Just be aware it’s not as big as you may think 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Alison L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for someone who likes hard scratching!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth $13 & they don't allow 30 day return. If you like to scratch your back hard enough to leave red marks this isn't for you! I hoped the 'spikes' would work great but they're flimsy plastic & not sharp enough to provide more than a dull, aggravating rub. You have to dig & dig with pressure in the same spot to get any relief. The original $5 bear claw works much better imo.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: BROKE WITHIN ONE WEEK
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this backscratcher because I've tried many of the cheap ones and they have all managed to break on me. Reading the reviews on this product, I was expecting something of more durable quality. When it first arrived, I was impressed by its seeming durability and sturdiness. I did not expect it to break. But just 7 days after it came, it broke just like the others. I am not even one to use the extending feature much. Unfortunate. Will continue looking.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Too top heavy to maneuver when telescopic handle is extended. The handle is not at the proper angle for effective back scratching. The cactus pads are too smooth to give any itch relief. Returned it and will use the usual bamboo scratcher until a better design is invented.
customer_reviews.author: pickyreader

customer_reviews.title: low quality, broke after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: was really great for scratching, its biggest problem was the head would turn to the angle of your back while being used and it would often go sideways or backwords because of this, due to its telescopic part. I say was because the telescopic part broke while I was extending it after not owning it long (and with little force I should add) so now I sadly don't have a back scratcher. I expected more for the price I paid, am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CREATOR CODE SiL3NT

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: What I disliked most about this product is by accident, I dropped it and it came apart. Now I can't use it anymore. But it did do the job, for a day.
customer_reviews.author: AngieH

customer_reviews.title: Not as amazing as other reviews say
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, because the other reviews raved about how wonderful it was. It's okay. It's not bad, it's just not mind blowing. It's light weight, so getting enough pressure is difficult. I think the 99 cent wood ones are better. The spikes are decent. It's made out of plastic. The handle is so lightweight, it's difficult to get enough pressure. Still, it's not bad. The handle retracts, which is nice. I haven't had it for very long, but it's not so light weight as to break easily. Still, if I pulled it out to full extension, it wouldn't take much to bend it in half. There are less expensive wood scratchers that I think are as good or better.
customer_reviews.author: N. C.

customer_reviews.title: better than a little bamboo hand
customer_reviews.text: I would like a small hard bristle brush with an extendable handle to be able to use a brush on the itch on my back, but I have never been able to find one that is suitable. This has come closest to the sort of scratcher I want because it distributes the scratching over a section of skin rather than in just one spot. I don't like the look of it or the material it's made from (minus one star), but it has been the best thing for scratching the itch on my back that has continued to plague me for years. If it had been a good hard bristle brush I would have given it ten stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect "scratchiness", but telescoping wand broke in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Rubbery plastic is just right for back-scratching... not too rough/sharp, and not too flimsy/soft. Unfortunately the telescoping part of the wand broke after only 2 weeks. Maybe my hubby was just using too much pressure. It would be the perfect back-scratcher if the wand was more sturdy. After it broke, he tried to continue using the top section with green "cactus" to scratch because it scratches very well, but without the wand it defeats the purpose because it doesn't reach far enough. Was a great back-scratcher until it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee Armour

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: It works okay, but the head swivels too much and the shaft telescopes or collapsed unintentionally. Too much trouble to send back so I’ll try to make it work. UPDATE: 5 months and it has fallen apart. Totally unusable. Will not replace with same type/brand. Save your money folks.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rock

customer_reviews.title: It scratches, but not in the good way.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly feel like I wasted money on this, the cheap ones I buy at the drug store were better. The points on this were pointy and too hard, leaving me with a painful scratching when I tried to use it. And I use back scratchers a lot, I have nerve damage from a couple of really bad sunburns (use your sunblock and if someone says they can't cover for you to go get it tell them to screw yourselves, it's not worth a lifetime of itchy sensation) and I was really hoping this would work out. On the up side it DOES scratch.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: broke in half on day no. 2
customer_reviews.text: the extender part on the cheap chrome handle, completely busted on day 2 with no unusual force....the cheap pin just snapped off and now the thing is only good for its 8 inch scratch....no more 25 inches.......asked for a replacement......it's a mighty good scrubber to scratch that dang back a dickens, i tell you....why it's not curved so it gnarls the dickens out of the lower back, I don't know....I want the most aggressive, blood reaching, itch killing maniacal monster metal scraper possible....maybe i just need a basic metal rake from Lowe's
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was good for a while
customer_reviews.text: This was a good scratcher for a few months but then the handle broke in the middle. Definitely the flaw with this. I was not using excessive force by any means but since the telescopic wand is made of thin and cheap tin it's only time till it gave way. If the wand can be beefed up then this would be a great back scratcher!!
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER ONE WEEK!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Simply extending the back scratcher and it broke. Would definitely not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Green

customer_reviews.title: Better than the claw
customer_reviews.text: In the past I ordered the wooden flat scratchers and 'the claw' but this is much better. This is wider and the points on the nubs offer a better scratch than the others. My kids like new toys so they have been offering to scratch my back so that's always a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: As I have seemed to be scratching my back more often as I age, I simply think this is the greatest. I use it when I am on my elliptical, while I walk, it is so effective. Better than asking someone to scratch, right, there. The extension mechanism is sturdy and seems like it will last for a long time, and since I use it almost every day, it has shown n o signs of weakening or coming apart. The "cactus" is a hoot, it really feels good through clothing and very stimulating on bare skin. I might even get one to keep in the car...
customer_reviews.author: RedpointRik

customer_reviews.title: Great back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical on this product but I LOVE IT!!! The long points are exactly what I was needing for my back rough enough to do the job but gentle. The smaller part is extremely gentle. The hand soft but firm to hold onto. And the paddle part is big enough to scratch enough more better than a claw. I also use it to scratch my feet and legs. This is a great product! And the color is a bound.
customer_reviews.author: MSPacheco

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it lasted, but the telescoping arm gets loose over time and comes apart. Had to replace the first one. They were great about sending a replacement, but that one just came apart as well! I can't return it because the return window was in Feb. Also, the telescoping arm turns when trying to scratch your back so it's hard to scratch the itch. Great concept, but poor quality and design. Wish I could return it. Going to find and old school one. Would not recommend. Won't last.
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Gal 123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome back scratcher.
customer_reviews.text: Either I am stupid or this does not extend to 26". I'm assuming it retracts twice. Mine only comes out once and it's a short length. I have tried turning every piece and pulling and it is jammed or something. But I'll keep it because even though it's not it's true length, it is still an awesome back scratcher. It reaches my spot that I have to have my partner scratch almost every day and my dogs eyes roll back when I use it on him haha 😂
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Back Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely more costly than most you see on the web and it's "just" to scratch your back; however, this item is well worth it. I like the sturdiness of it, the telescoping handle which allows me easily to access any spot. I also like the 2 sides with different "fingers". Definitely more than worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Len Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is a sensational idea. The plastic does not tear the skin as metal does. The two different textures are very useful. The lengthening handle fits all sorts of areas on the body. BUT the wand needs work. It moves around freely and doesn't lock into place. I can't keep it on the appropriate area. It also does not stay at the needed length. This may add to the price. As it is now, I do use it but always groan when the wand slips around or in and out
customer_reviews.author: bma

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Go old school.
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have had this for a while I can give an accurate review. Buy a bamboo back scratcher. The head on this spins around so you're getting a good scratch and then it rotates to the blunt side and you're just frustrated. Because there are knobs on both sides it's difficult to slide between your shirt and your skin without it becoming hung up on the shirt. The telescoping handle is flimsy and has already bent. I'm going to find some more bamboo back scratchers like I used to have, they work so much better.
customer_reviews.author: C. O.

customer_reviews.title: Was broken
customer_reviews.text: Was broken when I opened it the stick immediately came out. Was a big disappointment to my young son, as I got it for his Christmas stocking. He is always wanting me scratch his back.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Abreu

customer_reviews.title: Great back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I once gave this item a bad review because it wasnt what I expected and a I bought it as a gift. I just bought another one for myself. It seems like a stronger, more sturdy back scratcher than the other. Either that or I was unfairly harsh before. Anyways, this is my favorite back scratcher. It is sturdy, small, and can be extended to reach back as needed. It gets the itch. It’s convenient to carry. I recommend it to anyone needing such an item.
customer_reviews.author: Zita

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: It rocks! I love this thing. I gave it a 4 for sturdiness because the head can spin while you use it which I find annoying. But seriously, I am so glad I spent the money in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sue U

customer_reviews.title: I’m conflicted
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad and honestly I kept stealing it lol. It’s a good scratcher. It did break though. Fell apart like all the other bad reviews. I got it for Christmas last year for reference. So it lasted like 7 months. I’m conflicted whether to buy a new one and get two this time lol. I guess that kinda happens with retractable ones though.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Best back scratcher I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I got this product from a recommendation, after a surgery that limited my range of motion in my arms. I was hesitant as it’s double the price of a lot of back scratchers, but it’s worth it. The two different sides of the scratcher, the area of the scratcher, and the length of the handle all make this great for getting anywhere you can’t reach. If you’re in the market for a back scratcher this is the best you’re gonna get! (Also great for petting cats and dogs from a distance, they love it too!)
customer_reviews.author: Chase Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Lord have mercy...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best back scratcher ever. Well, the full size cactus back scratcher is BETTER, but this is top of the heap for this retractable handle design. I don't even bother with the more rounded, nubby side. I want the sharper side. It's back-scratching nirvana. The handle is sturdy. I've put it though quite a lot of pressure and it's held up great. I've gifted them to several people because no one needs an itchy back.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a hand full of times. The pin fell out of the extender, & isn’t repairable. Seems a shame. The scratcher is well made, but the extender needs to be tweaked. I changed my rating from a 2 to a 5 star on this because the seller immediately replaced my scratcher for free. I really do love this thing. It scratches your itch without scratching your skin, & it has a long reach - which is nice. I’ve bought a total of 3 of these for gifts. Everyone seems to love them.
customer_reviews.author: NapaValley

customer_reviews.title: Broke within months!
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I originally gave this 4 stars, but months later I am changing it to 2 stars! I’ve only had this for a couple of months and the entire top of the scratcher broke off! Just snapped right in half! I tried putting duct tape on it to secure it till I could replace it, but it was so flimsy that didn’t even work!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The long telescoping feature makes it perfect
customer_reviews.text: I can adjust the length of this thing to any length I need, which enables me to reach any spot I need to scratch. sometimes I like the sharper side, and sometimes the more rounded side. There's not much to it, but it does everything I need it to. UPDATE: Now that I've had it a few months, I've found a problem. sometimes when you pull it to make it longer, the scratcher part comes off the handle. I could avoid this If I'd pull it really carefully, and I can put it back together, but it's kind of a hassle to do so.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campisi

customer_reviews.title: No more itches
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has had many back surgeries and has itchy incisions and scars going the length of her back that no scrather could help. Until now, she loves the catus, although she has limited mobility with her arms the catus allows her to reach everywhere and the extra large scratching nubs (not sure what they're really called) bring relief. I will definitely buy a new one if its ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy extender
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a back scratcher that won't become lose once I fully extend it and I have finally found it. This back scratcher has been everything that I wanted and then some. It has 2 scratching sides and they both feel fantastic. My favorite being the side with the longer peaks. It gives a deeper scratch that feels great. If you're looking for back scratcher look a great back scratcher look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I loved it, until the pole broke.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I did a bit of a double take on the price, but I love this thing, both sides feel great. And if it flips around while you’re getting it in place it doesn’t matter because both sides are good. Sad up date. The center of the pole gave out. I’ve tried taping it, but it hasn’t helped much. Very disappointing, especially at the cost.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Great back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself but everyone in my family loves this back scratcher. It’s great! You have two options for the type of scratch you want. It’s compact enough that it’s not in the way and the telescope handle makes it easy to reach any itch. So far it’s held up nicely to the whole family using it. I highly recommend this back scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa key

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Was bought as a gift. Person loved it but its a bit shorter than expected so doesnt reach all the spots on the back but its the best feel and sturdiness of any others. Had a different one that rotated at extension spot which is why we bought this one to try. Over all very happy
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Why did I not buy earlier!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest. I am older and have seborrhoea keratosis on back and no ability to reach and scratch. The lesions come from sun exposure. Not cancerous but they itch sometimes and drive me nuts. This little tool is great. I’m going to buy a few more and give to friends!!
customer_reviews.author: ewokinco

customer_reviews.title: One of the Better Back Scratchers Out There
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement back scratcher after the one I had (from another manufacturer) was discontinued and decided to give this one a try. I'm really glad I did! Very handy and I like that it telescopes so it is easy to store. I bought one for home and just had to get one for my car to remedy those back itches while on a long drive. Because it is so compact, I'm most likely going to get another one for my briefcase when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F

customer_reviews.title: Not flimsy like the bear claw metal scratcher
customer_reviews.text: The estimated shipping/arrival time was a little wack, but now it's here and it's perfect for my back! Strong, sturdy, with two bump settings for a more or less aggressive scratch session. Smaller bumps are good for scratching sensitive or tender skin. Feels good all over, kinda like a massage when you use it. Previously owned the bear claw shaped metal scratcher, but it would constantly flip around to the side without claws. Also the metal scratcher would bend with use, and eventually the metal fatigued and broke. I chose the cactus scratcher because it has spikes/bumps on both sides and it looks like it will never break!
customer_reviews.author: Cherdburger

customer_reviews.title: The best back scratcher ever!
customer_reviews.text: The best back scratcher every made! It has a nice, long, retractable handle so you can get every itch. The two sided cactus head is amazing! You don't tear your skin up like you do with the metal ones. It'll even double as a head massager. Seriously, this is there best back scratcher on the market!
customer_reviews.author: KrazyK

customer_reviews.title: Telescopic handle rotates on back, breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: The handle is adjustable but the head rotates in use... sometimes the side of the head (the non-scratching side) rotates and gives a very unsatisfactory scratch. I also sat on mine accidentally and this item is very delicate. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Astrocloud

customer_reviews.title: gets the itch but not great
customer_reviews.text: The cactus part broke after a few days. Still functional but sad to hear it pop and crack. Also, it is not sturdy at all when you are using it. When you are scratching with it, it will twist around and not stay still. Yes it gets the job done but I would not recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: Easy On The Skin
customer_reviews.text: I bought to try out the plastic versus the metal prong. The metal one was of great quality, but my skin has gotten thiner so have to be extra careful when using the other back scratcher. This plastic version is comfortable, not hard on my skin, and is of better quality than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little product! There’s always an itch on my back that I can’t reach and this little item is handy and ready to get it. I keep it near my workspace at home. It has two sides, btw, one with sharper points and one with blunter points.
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: Great back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: If you need a back scratcher and are serious about it, go with this one. It extends to a pretty good length and is pointy enough to do the job on the sharper side. I have given these to several family members as gifts and they regularly thank me for them years later.
customer_reviews.author: 302cobraguy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Why these are hard to find locally ill never know? Been scratching my back in door ways for years. Until now!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, makes itches easy to reach
customer_reviews.text: So I keep this by my bed and its such a great compact size, that expands to however long you need it. It has two lengths, one shorter on one side, and longer on the other. Honestly I could use it a little sharper perhaps, but I am pleased. I would recommend it based on adjustable size alone.
customer_reviews.author: ALK95

customer_reviews.title: A welcome relief!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that would scratch my back without leaving marks or hurting. Since this has 2 sides, it give you a choice how you want it to feel . It really does the trick for me. It’s well made, the arm is easy to extend and has a long reach. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Read A. Lot

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, could be better
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating this four of five stars across the board. It's sturdy, but could be sturdier. It's easy to use, but it routinely gets stuck when I try to telescope it. The range of motion is okay, but it also collapses in on itself quite frequently. Still, it gets the job done, and it's better than those horrid flimsy metal back scratchers. Glad I made the purchase, and I might buy another if this one bites the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: I don't waste time writing reviews. This back scratcher is so great, I bought two more as gifts within one month. My kids love using it, and it hasn't broken with their use. I gave the latest one to my Dad, who placed it in with his tv remotes so he has it close. We have sensitive (think easily bothered, allergic-prone skin) in our family, and the rough side of this back scratcher doesn't cause hives, but does relieve itches.
customer_reviews.author: RAHK

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: I honestly was just sitting on the couch, back itchy and I thought, hey I’ll order a back scratcher. This arrived a few days later and my life is the better for it. This works well without scratching up my skin. I can get my shoulder blades easily. The two sides really allows me to get deep into the itch.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: the plus is the scratcher part is better than most as most are too soft/flimsy to get a good scratch of your itch that being said the adjustable handle part not sturdy. I had one and it broke within a month- that being said I bought another one hopeful it lasts longer as I do like the scratcher part.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim because I was tired of asking my hubs to scratch my back. It has been so much better than I expected. And now I have to fight my husband for it. It does twist a little when using but that can be solved once you get the hang of it. It is not too sharp but sharp enough to get the job done. Very sturdy and easy to clean too. The extendable handle is genius.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not for The Faint of Hands
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands and shoulders. The handle on this back scratcher is round and thin. It does not provide leverage or ease of positioning on the back, especially because the scratching head is two-sided. I like the idea of the extendable length but it was useless for me because it is difficult to manipulate. I guess I'll have to go back to my old bamboo standby.
customer_reviews.author: vpa

customer_reviews.title: Best back scratcher ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth it. All the metal back scratcher I have purchased break and bend when you apply too much pressure. This one holds up nice. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizeth Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Tough to Push Back Together
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend so he can scratch his back when I'm not there too. He was so excited when he received it and used it immediately. He loves both sides of the stick and the grip at the bottom. The only trouble he had was pushing the extended pieces back together, the last part kept getting stuck. Great product and for a decent price
customer_reviews.author: Christiana

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be a bear
customer_reviews.text: My wife looked at my funny when I bought two of these. Let me tell you, game changer! I wear a Kevlar vest for work which makes it impossible to get an itch unless I have something to stick down between my vest and my back. I would often try and rub up against a wall like a bear while in the office which proved to be a little weird. This thing is perfect. One side is more abrasive than the other depending on how bad the itch is. I got one for home and one for work.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up after some pretty intense back sunburn, was itching pretty bad. I used the ones that look like the little hand before, but decided to try this. It does have a great option for one side the spikes on it are curved so you can itch a scratch more softly than the other side. Great product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kms1

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like the scratch head, the "fingers" are well placed to cover a whole itchy spot at a time. I also like the adjustable handle. It keeps its length during use instead of slipping to a shorter length like others often do. And finally, it soothes the itchy places completely!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased; improvement on standard rake back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this back scratcher. I generally keep a few of the standard metal backscratchers within reach here and there, but this is an improvement on the old design. More scratching surface than the standard small metal rake. The plastic head is hard enough to do the job but the tips are very slightly blunted so you won’t scrape your skin. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Claire K

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 weeks before it came apart!
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the Cactus Back Scratcher I was thrilled with it! I'm sad to say that it came apart within 2 weeks of using it. I had even ordered two more to keep in other places. I plan to return for replacement, lets see how it goes!
customer_reviews.author: BigBroZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My dad has been using the same backscratcher since the 80’s. The wood is split, it’s been taped and glued together for years now. No other backscratcher seemed to have the right angle, so they would always end up in the trash. This poped up scrolling through social media, so I decided to take a chance and order it for his birthday. Success! He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Chell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your $$$
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this product as it was much smaller and weaker than I thought it would be. The actual "scratchy" part was the size of an oreo cookie, and the telescoping handle does not seem like it will hold up well. This was intended to be a present for my father, who is a burly working man and it does not "make the cut" for that standard.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Cook

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: My husband is still favoring his old wooden scratcher. He's afraid he'll break the new one. I love it and it is just what I expected, but as they say, "You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him use his new back scratcher."
customer_reviews.author: jspassnthru

customer_reviews.title: Best back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Bought this three times. Once for me, it broke, but bought it again because it really is the best back scratching experience I had. And then I had to get it for my mom and father in law too. A family in need of back scratching!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: It scratches my very dry itchy back well... If the head would just not rotate while scratching
customer_reviews.text: This scratches well If I could find I a way to attach the head so it doesn't rotate when scratching. There must be a way to glue the scratching head so it stays put and doesn't hinder any thing else this does.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product!! Does the Job!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product much better than the smaller, metal back scratchers as I have BOTH kinds. It's a GREAT product for the price! The only thing I DON'T like about it, is that the plastic "head" spins around when scratching, which changes the "surface" you want to "scratch" with!!
customer_reviews.author: FL Girl

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: One true piece of trash. Shaft collapsed upon FIRST USE; no human of any age could not fail to break this thing! You'd do better finding a tree for your back; like a bear.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Powell

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Product!!! Best Back Scratcher I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I love the two different sides and the quality! I can reach places very well with this and so glad I found it! I also have one that I reach over and scratch the dogs with LOL and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great backscratcher with sturdy retractable handle.
customer_reviews.text: I have a chronically itchy back and have struggled to find a non-flimsy backscratcher. This one is great. I really wasn't sure what it would be like based on the pictures. It's great. The fact that it the head has more "scratchers" than the typical backscratcher means it gets the job done more efficiently and completely. Both sides work well. I bought three of these (two were gifts). Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Fitbit Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Wife says .,. Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Greatly appreciate two features .,. it fits into a purse with easy and yet extended it reaches every corner of the back, and, it is very sturdy. Best back scratcher we had in our 55 years of marriage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love the back scratcher. Its the cactus type. Love that it telescopes so u can store it easily. It is just the right length. Mom has limited scope of range with her arms and this is easy for her to get that itchy place. Ive used it to massage her scalp too! A unexpected plus!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Warren

customer_reviews.title: A+ Back Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome back scratcher. Really well built. I break the handles on the bear claw ones all the time. This scratcher is sturdy, strong and each side give you relief from the itch in a unique way. Great communication on my order and quick shipping. I will buy more for gifts and stocking stuffers.
customer_reviews.author: Jnae

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Painless
customer_reviews.text: The best ever. Doesn’t dig into my sensitive skin. Suggestion, if you don’t already have one, design a similar form without knubbles so that customers can apply cream to their backs,
customer_reviews.author: Joe@seaview

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed!!
customer_reviews.text: This back scratcher worked well UNTIL it completely dislodged at the extension connection--now is a piece of junk! Am amazed that Amazon allows this merchandise to be sold on Amazon site- Will defintely be looking at product reviews before ordering anything else from site!
customer_reviews.author: eloise daniel

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Immediately used it right out of the package. Perfect for any itchy back related to menopausal "bugs crawling" sensation. Ahhhhhh... I would recommend it. As far as longevity and durability I will have to wait and see. Purchasing is an itch that got scratched. !
customer_reviews.author: anne marshall

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: It can't hurt you (it's plastic), the handle is nicely long (and retractable) , and it reduces the skin-creeping itches of sweaty summer. Thank you for back-saver!
customer_reviews.author: unsworthyeti

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I've tried numerous back scratcher in the past and this one is Great!!! Stiff with both long and short prongs. The handle is long and reaches all areas of my back. Great product
customer_reviews.author: ABM

customer_reviews.title: Scratch away
customer_reviews.text: Best pre-quarantine purchase! I went to throw it on the couch and it bounced off and hit the floor and plastic pieces came undone. Drop of crazy glued solved that and have had no other issues.
customer_reviews.author: kyle f.

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: The spikes are nice but it falls apart quickly. You can't put any pressure whatsoever on the back scratcher once it's extended. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: My Boyfriend LOVES this back scratcher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great back scratcher! It's pretty durable for the price, although my boyfriend did sit on it and ended up breaking the handle off. He's the one at fault for that, not so much the product. He still uses it anyway and enjoys it throughouly
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Since I have reached the dry, itchy years of my life, I have been looking for the ideal back scratcher. After much research I chose this on! Best choice I could have maade. I will be recommend this item to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Solved Problem
customer_reviews.text: I have used metal back scratchers and have really torn the skin on my back. This works well and doesn't tear up the skin.. Debbie M.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was hoping for when I ordered this item. It's study and straightforward to use. It now has a permanent spot on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Great scratch. Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It did the trick for a while. I liked the telescoping length. Then it broke after a week. It got stuck been the sectional and by 7 year old daughter pulled it apart trying to get it out. My cheap wooden one scratches almost as well for a fraction of the price and I've had it for years.
customer_reviews.author: carlson

customer_reviews.title: love it - long prong side is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Short-prong side is not much use but the long prong side does a great job and it's nice and long. The telescoping is nice but I don't really use it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Itch in the back
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to get rid of the itch in my back. I have tried to use ones in the stores but they were too small and not appropriate for what was needed. I have tried using my hand but can not reach certain areas in my back. This was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.Rock

customer_reviews.title: Bestest Most Perfect Back-scratcher EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is a great back scratcher. This is the the present that keeps on giving. Super durable! Love the ability to resize! So easy to use. Compact! Give this as a gift and the recipient might not show it on the outside but on the inside they will be ecstatic!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Hits the spot!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS! Surprisingly so does my cat! This company should market these things as a cat toy because my little girl loves her scratchy toy! So I ordered ANOTHER!
customer_reviews.author: Jcocchieri

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Folds up small so you can take with you! Didn’t expect it to be so compact. Do wish you could bend it a little for an angle, but then it wouldn’t be strong. L recommend this for you itch!
customer_reviews.author: Lori H

customer_reviews.title: I had to go back to using my fingernails.
customer_reviews.text: "Scratching head" pivots upon use, no good way of telling if optimum scratching projections are correctly engaged. In other words, it might be "on edge" or as much as 90 degrees off. Can't see behind my back to tell. Both sides of scratching head are of equally indistinguishable hardness. With closely matched length, the two sides should either be made of different materials or the "soft" side drawn to a narrower taper. Gregory Devane
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trust me, and dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for two months now, it fell off my hands hit the floor no more that two feet at most, and it broke. Look at images, and do you can see for yourself. One its poorly manufactured Two the actual scratcher piece is plastic and held together by crazy glue. Again TRUST ME and DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, two sided, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this back scratcher! Its sturdy and has 2 different sides to be used depending on how vigorous you want to scratch. The handle is adjustable unlike other. I also selected this because it is sturdier than wood and the surface of the scratcher does what it's supposed to do without leaving scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great back scratcher but it has broken and been crazy glued at least 3 times in the last few months. When closing the telescope handle there is nothing stopping it from going all the way down and it ends up separating the two cactus pieces. Buying the version on the string would obviously eliminate this problem but that doesn’t help me now!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney MB

customer_reviews.title: Aah - so nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the back scratcher on the stick. It works really well to get to those hard to reach itches. I like both styles of points - I'm probably using the gentler one a bit more. The handle is easy to work. Just one of those nice little products that solve a need and make life more pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Trad24

product_meta.title: Cactus Back Scratcher On a Stick -16 Spikes per Side -Aggressive & Milder Spikes - Strong ABS Plastic - 25” Full to 8.5" Compact - Sturdy Metal Retractable - 5 Sections -Perfect Gift for Anyone
feature_bullets: ONE-HANDED easy to use back scratcher with comfort grip handle
EXTENDABLE from 8.5 inch portable, compact length to 25 inches so you can reach far and wide
STRONG EXTENSION POLE with 5 extendable sections and scratching head made from durable ABS plastic
TWO DIFFERENT LEVELS OF SPIKES with 16 spikes per side for best surface to body contact – 8 colors available
FAR REACHING for backs, beards, bellies and any other body part

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
